name: Assault: Retribution
description:
Assault: Retribution is a 3D run and gun platform game. Its story takes place in the year 2198. Arcadia, a world far away from Earth, is under attack by aliens. As members of the Arcadia Defense Force, the player takes part in the fight against the invaders.

Featuring 3D graphics, the game's perspective varies from side scrolling to top down. There are 4 weapons available to each character, though the differences are mostly cosmetic (a weak gun with wide spread, a stronger but slightly slower gun, a homing weapon, and a powerful BFG). As the character picks up a Gun item, the character's next tier gun slot is filled. Each gun can be upgraded three times, which increases the number of shots fired per trigger pull, but also increases energy drain. Energy can be recovered by picking up the appropriate item, as can health. It is also possible to store health or energy for later use (though each character has only one item slot). Other pick ups includes an invulnerable energy sphere (can't be stored), lighting barrier and bonus lives. Besides the usual movement and shooting, the characters can also aim up, down at various angles and have a 'strafe/ side step' move.

There are seven action packed levels. Multiplayer is possible in two-player co-op mode.

Character Selection
(Level 1: City) Energy (ammo) and Health pick-ups. Both can be stored for later use (Each character can only carry one pick-up, though)
The game occasionally changes the perspective and movement direction. For a break from side-scrolling, the character now moves deeper into the complex.
Now the perspective switches to top down. The character has picked up an invulnerability sphere, and has a sort of lightning barrier saved for later use.
(Level 2: Alien Corridor) Lightning barrier activated
This scene reminds me of Contra.
This one, too. Escaping collapsing platforms.
(Level 3: Jungle Crash site) Crashlanding on another planet.
The Starfire is Kelly's strongest weapon. One attack fires a few shots that track enemies; this one fires a devastating energy ball that uses up all energy.
Neutron warhead? Sounds cool!
But not so cool when it's about to scorch you. I suppose the boss meant "Run like hell" when he said "Take cover".
(Level 4: Lift) Alien eggs, sentry guns. Hmm, sounds familiar.
It's advisable to switch to the default gun before trying anything dangerous, since dying twice while carrying a non-default gun means you lose it.
Racing to the lab to save the scientists. Boss' order.
A compulsory driving sub-level
... with a wimpy mini-boss.
Later parts include explosive barrels and random electric bolts. At least you don't lose your gun when you die.
(Level 5: Science Room) Somehow I don't want to see what "it" is.
Uh oh, that doesn't sound good.
The guy explodes, having mutated into a mutant.
OK, I'll swallow the 'injecting DNA' part. But how does the gun come packaged with the DNA?
Yeah, thank you boss, for ordering me to come to this lab to save some GODDAMN CRAZY ZOMBIES. Kelly's gonna kick his ass when she gets back.
Laser corridor in a laboratory. Pretty innovative for a pre-2000 game, I guess.
You can only walk on the 'floor' if it gets foggy like this. Never mind the giant, jumping, fireball-throwing fish/leech/whatever.
(Level 6: Docking bay) You have to shoot the explosive barrel to proceed. Even if it causes rocks to fall all over the place. No questions!
Kelly escapes on a shuttle.
And makes her way inside.
I didn't get what she meant at first.
But now I do. Kelly's pretty genre-savvy, no?
Riding a machine to another part of the space station.
Even more interesting, Kelly can too, without any protective gear or even a mask.
You might think a boss is coming.
Wrong! It's another "run like hell" segment. At least now the boss says it right.
Yeah. Quite refreshing after all the orders which basically means "kill everything that moves".
Final level: Outside Hive
Inside the main alien's nest
What do you expect? A tea party?
He's wide awake. Happy now?
No it doesn't. Because the thing's dead.
